meanings.definition: One who holds a false belief or disbelief.
meanings.sent1: The misbeliever refused to accept the truth.
meanings.sent2: The misbeliever was convinced that the earth was flat.
meanings.sent3: The misbeliever thought the moon was made of cheese!
meanings.sent4: She was a misbeliever in the power of positive thinking.
meanings.sent5: The misbeliever's stubbornness knew no bounds.

meanings.definition: To hold a false belief or disbelief.
meanings.sent1: He would misbelieve any evidence presented to him.
meanings.sent2: She misbelieves in superstitions and omens.
meanings.sent3: Don't misbelieve everything you hear, use your judgment.
meanings.sent4: His mind misbelieves the reality of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The child misbelieves in monsters under the bed.
